info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 02 at 8:25PM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills dropping down to around 15 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches tonight through tomorrow. * WHERE...The combined Oklahoma and Texas Panhandle. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia and could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
